comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I've visited a web site that has Facebook Like box in it while I was logged in/out to Facebook.


Actual results:

Facebook recorded that I have visited that web site.


Expected results:

Facebook should not be able to set cookies and similar things (storage) to Firefox when I'm on that web site.

Please provide a black list option for such acts. I don't want to be tracked. Might be edited from about:permissions.

comments.creator: u279076@disabled.tld
comments.author: u279076@disabled.tld
comments.text: Does/should DO-NOT-TRACK extend to this sort of activity? I think so, at least opt-in to blocking such activity.
comments.raw_text: Does/should DO-NOT-TRACK extend to this sort of activity? I think so, at least opt-in to blocking such activity.

comments.author: toover@toover.me
comments.text:
I think you can prevent this now that there is a setting to refuse third-party cookies.
It means you cannot get Facebook cookies while visiting another website.
comments.creator: toover@toover.me
